CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bernice DeLouvpre, 1705 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 2, 1957, pg. 2, with question: "Do you believe that one political party should be in control of all the offices in the city, county, and state?" answer reads: "No, I don't. This is a democracy and if the same political party has all the offices, you won't know what the other party can do."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bernice DeLouvpre, wearing plaid head scarf and herringbone coat with four buttons, standing in front of car with buildings in background
